gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/179)
text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُوسَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ الْجَلَّابِ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِنَا قَالَ شَكَا رَجُلٌ إِلَى أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) الْبَهَقَ فَأَمَرَهُ أَنْ يَطْبُخَ الْمَاشَ وَ يَتَحَسَّاهُ وَ يَجْعَلَهُ فِي طَعَامِهِ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Muhammad Bin Musa, from Ahmad Bin Al Hassan Al Jallab, from one of his companions who said,
‘A man complained to Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> of vitiligo, so he<sup>asws</sup> ordered him that he should cook the Mung-beans, and apportion it and make it to be in his meal’.
en.sarwar: 1. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Muhammad ibn Musa from Ahmad ibn al-Hassan al-Jallab certain persons of our people who have said the following: “Once a man complained before abu al-Hassan, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about vitiligo (white spots on one’s skin) and he (the Imam) commanded him to cook al-Mash then drink it and make it a part of his food.”
